fact_check_explanation_summary: Seventeen countries in Europe have temporarily stopped using the Covid-19 vaccine.

fact_check_explanation_title: Clapham protester is not same woman injured in Parsons Green Tube attack
fact_check_explanation_summary: Social media posts falsely claim that a woman arrested during the Clapham vigil is the same woman who was injured in the Parsons Green Tube attack.

fact_check_explanation_title: The public dislikes disruptive protests—but less than the Telegraph says
fact_check_explanation_summary: People are strongly against violence or serious disruption at protests, but opinion is more balanced when the inconvenience is smaller.

fact_check_explanation_title: Extrapolating figures around long Covid in kids is not the way to go
fact_check_explanation_summary: The prevalence of long Covid in children is not yet fully known, and we need caution when we discuss the figures.

fact_check_explanation_title: This text from a GP is real
fact_check_explanation_summary: Facebook users were concerned that a public health message sent by text from a GP surgery was not genuine. The GP practice has said it’s real.

fact_check_explanation_title: Clearing up the NHS pay debate
fact_check_explanation_summary: Parliament made a commitment to raise the total NHS budget, but did not specify how that money should be spent.

fact_check_explanation_title: Has the NHS had its budget reduced by £30 billion?
fact_check_explanation_summary: Labour claims that the Budget took £30bn out of day to day health spending, this is true if you include the withdrawal of last year’s Covid money.

fact_check_explanation_title: NHS Test and Trace has not spent £37bn so far
fact_check_explanation_summary: A post on social media uses the total two-year Test and Trace budget to make misleading claims about where the money is going.

fact_check_explanation_title: What happens when pupils test positive for Covid-19?
fact_check_explanation_summary: There’s been some confusion over whether pupils can return to school after a positive lateral flow test but a negative PCR result.

fact_check_explanation_title: Misleading claims about Serco’s role in Test and Trace resurface
fact_check_explanation_summary: Most of the money spent on Test and Trace goes on testing. Serco plays a big part in tracing, but does not receive a majority of the funding.

fact_check_explanation_title: Side effects from the Oxford and Pfizer vaccines are about the same
fact_check_explanation_summary: An article in the Express is misleading when it says that the Oxford Covid-19 vaccine has ‘more adverse side effects’.

fact_check_explanation_title: There are no mouse brains in Covid-19 vaccines
fact_check_explanation_summary: A viral Facebook post makes a number of claims about the ingredients and side effects of vaccines.
